intro: Cheiridopsis peculiaris, commonly known as the peculiar sand mat, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, fleshy, blue-green leaves. It produces vibrant yellow flowers during the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability to arid environments, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
